BOTTOM.disc: The Indian Stock Market is a dynamic platform that offers investors the opportunity to invest their funds in listed shares of various companies to become stakeholders, earn dividends and thus, pave their way through the journey of wealth creation. While there are numerous profitable stocks available in the Indian Stock Market, it is imperative to include some best fundamentally strong stocks in India to offset any potential losses incurred during downturns in the market

BOTTOM.title: Factors influencing Indian Stock Markets:
list: Global Events: Positive developments worldwide can encourage investors to participate in the stock market. However, global events like economic crises or conflicts between countries might lead to a huge amount of uncertainty in financial markets. These uncertainties and increased risk probabilities can make beginner-level investors risk-averse.
Economic Indicators: Various economic indicators like changes in GDP growth, Interest rates, employment rates, etc. can lead to fluctuations in the financial market trends.

Government Policies: Government policies include monetary policy, fiscal policy and other important regulations with respect to the Indian Stock Market. Favourable government regulations and policies can positively contribute to positive market trends. However, unfavourable or fluctuating policies of the government might create confusion or pessimism among investors.

Company Performance: Company performance is directly proportionate to the investment patterns in the stock market. If the company performs well and the revenue growth increases, it creates an optimistic feeling among the investors. However, if a company underperforms, there will be a feeling of pessimism among investors with respect to market trends.

Inflation & Exchange rates: Inflation rates have a direct impact on the purchasing power of the funds, thus influencing investment decisions and stock market trends. On the other hand, constant changes in exchange rates can lead to chaotic international relations of the companies, further leading to instability in the stock market.
Political Environment: Political instability or wars can significantly bring down the performance of companies, thus negatively impacting the stock market.
Natural Disasters: Natural disasters can bring a massive downturn in various sectors like insurance companies, agriculture-based companies, etc.

BOTTOM.title: Fundamentally Strong Stocks In India

These are the stocks that will continue to perform well even if other sectors in the stock market are underperforming. One of the most intelligent investing strategies is the inclusion of these stocks in the portfolio of an investor, which will help maintain a balance during bearish trends in the market.

list: The first and foremost step to building a well-balanced portfolio is to be clear about one’s financial goals, investment tenure and risk appetite. Having these identified, it will be easier to build a personalised portfolio accordingly.
